revised_title: Microbial Interactions and Community Dynamics in Sediment Mineralization
tldr: This article explores the complex interactions and competition among various anaerobic bacteria in sediment communities, focusing on the processes of methanogenesis and sulfate reduction. The authors discuss the factors influencing the dominance of these processes, such as sulfate availability, and the role of microbial communities in the mineralization of organic matter in aquatic ecosystems.
